column1: Now come on @RepDanKildee compromise is not a curse word.  You should relay to @SpeakerPelosi COVID aid is needed and a compromise is there if the priority is to actually assist the American people.  Oh - silly me.  I know it is just about power politics. https://t.co/VD8MGXbqMC

#ICYMI: This week I spoke with Guy Gordon about the importance of an effective transition between presidents the latest COVID shutdowns in #Michigan and the status of COVID relief.   Listen below 📻 ⬇️ https://t.co/1YFHLchiSb
Another vaccine showing success in preventing COVID. Great news. Moderna coronavirus vaccine nearly 95% effective in early analysis https://t.co/CFTvUKFEsl

I will decline to retweet the ignorant post of a newly elected Member of Congress regarding masks and add to that Tweet storm.  Apparently notoriety is her objective. Masks help protest OTHERS!  COVID is real. But science is lost on someone that also supports Q’anon.

Reminder: #Michigan farmers impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic have until December 11th to apply for the @USDA Coronavirus Food Assistance Program.   Find more information and the application below ⬇️ https://t.co/xqtV4fso5z

A safe and effective #COVID19 vaccine is a key component in defeating this virus and returning to our way of life. This news about Pfizer’s trials showing positive results is very encouraging. https://t.co/colBeUonin

I have depended upon data and science throughout my life. #COVID19 is a challenge which we must address with data science and reason — not fear. This data should drive our policy decisions. https://t.co/8qvxpF227L

As Michiganders get ready for Halloween tomorrow it’s important we remain diligent in following CDC guidelines to reduce the spread of COVID-19. Click below for guidance on how to have a safe and happy Halloween🎃 https://t.co/0wZhxLBLga

Our approach to #COVID19 should be scientific and sensible. We can allow folks to live their lives in a safe and responsible way rather than instilling fear and panic about this virus.    Listen to a clip from my interview yesterday w/ Paul Miller on @WPHMradio⬇️ https://t.co/EMKM6SXKXr

At the beginning of the pandemic we didn’t know much about #COVID19 which led to mass lockdowns.  Since March we have learned a lot about the virus and now we know how to keep the virus under control while keeping our economy & society open. https://t.co/s83bSRMln8

Small businesses are the backbone of our nation’s economy and have been hit especially hard during the #COVID19 pandemic.   During this #SmallBusinessWeek let’s show support for our community’s small businesses by shopping local! https://t.co/nDndSsV8gi
Read my latest op-ed on why it is not the federal government’s responsibility to bail out state and local governments in the next coronavirus relief package⬇️ https://t.co/wnANWKVdSx

Another $500B to state & local governments does little to re-open businesses or create jobs.  It is just another bailout - plain and simple.   @SpeakerPelosi is putting a bailout for progressive politicians ahead of real #COVID19 relief. https://t.co/uC4MVR0bK9

The #COVID19 pandemic & its disruption of traditional schools has further highlighted just how important school choice is. Read my op-ed w/ @SenatorTimScott about the importance of equipping all students with the individualized tools they need to succeed⬇️ https://t.co/numD6fe33w
This #LaborDay I’m especially grateful to all essential workers who have gone above and beyond to help during the #COVID19 pandemic.

I have contended that prolonged lockdowns or stay at home orders are damaging to our families and our future.  This article analyzes approaches of many countries and states - worth the read by all policymakers. I don’t believe COVID will just disappear. https://t.co/XWFxB6RntJ
Well - that certainly displays the “spirit” requires to achieve compromise on a COVID aid package.  Just wow. https://t.co/dCXPdpoyuH
#ICYMI: This morning I spoke with Paul Miller on @WPHMradio about the U.S. Postal Service and the status of #COVID19 relief. Listen to the full interview below ⬇️📻 https://t.co/QviNt4XZwa

@twu591president - I suggest you reach out to @SpeakerPelosi and @LeaderHoyer and reinforce this concern.  Lots of needs for COVID aid but all that came to floor was the USPS fabricated crisis bill. They control the floor of House. https://t.co/zRsU4CztHV

It's disappointing that instead of working on much needed #COVID19 relief @SpeakerPelosi called an ‘emergency’ session for a supposed crisis at the #USPS. The facts are clear – there is no emergency Democrats have chosen to spread misinformation for political gain. Read More:

Good news: #Michigan’s request for additional unemployment insurance funds was approved by @fema. These funds will ensure those still out of work due to #COVID19 have the support they need and I thank @realDonaldTrump for his continued support. https://t.co/U20pfbpr7B
Meanwhile - @SpeakerPelosi calls back the House for her conspiracy vote rather than a vote on a #COVID19 aid package. https://t.co/ldbX1uC2k7

Another opinion on the USPS crisis conspiracy @SpeakerPelosi is pushing.  It would be great if she actually negotiated on a bipartisan Coronavirus assistance package instead of this distraction. https://t.co/WpodRJZodx

News for #Michigan Farmers: Yesterday the @USDA announced the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program will cover additional commodities and the deadline to apply has been extended to Friday September 11 2020. Find more information and the application: https://t.co/Q5fpkBGjr7 https://t.co/Yiw2Nscflk

Efforts by @POTUS to provide relief recognize the significance of #COVID19 but there is still the need for further Congressional action. I urge my colleagues in Congress to negotiate in good faith the next relief package that can be signed into law.   https://t.co/zOSjHlXfDp

A key advisor in the no-bid contact tracing contract won’t talk with Auditor General!  And ⁦@GovWhitmer⁩ demands more “flexibility” in spending Federal COVID aid $$?  I think not! https://t.co/57oozkHc6h

Job growth continues for the 3rd straight month as America begins moving forward in dealing with COVID. Unemployment rate also feel this month.  Still too high but headed in a better direction. https://t.co/drvQZVMLxk
@Not2PC44 Gee - you failed to ask when the photo was taken before your comment.  News flash - photo is from a visit prior to the COVID issues when I visited the Port Huron CG Station.

Wearing a mask isn’t just about protecting yourself – it’s about protecting those around you. We’ve made great strides in the fight against #COVID__19 and it’s important we all continue to do our part to #StopTheSpread by wearing a mask when around others. https://t.co/xFOaCSJx7l

@RepJoshG it isn’t the House blocking another COVID package - it is Speaker Pelosi and D leadership.  The “Heroes” Act was a $3.4T negotiating ploy and the unwillingness of Pelosi and Schumer to negotiate in good faith is a disaster for America.  Sad. https://t.co/FiKkG3VkWO

If you’ve fully recovered from #Covid_19 your plasma now contains antibodies that may help others fight the disease. There is an ongoing nationwide effort to collect plasma from eligible patients to study the effectiveness of convalescent plasma treatment for COVID-19 patients. https://t.co/AbWtKFvmQ9
I’m proud to see #Michigan play an important role in the ongoing effort to develop a #COVID19 vaccine which is vital to countering this pandemic. https://t.co/RjsdHqNP8q

I guess that makes sense in Nevada if you ignore the Constitution.  Emergency Orders by some Governors make a mockery of our Bill of Rights and Federal Courts accept that.  Supreme Court: Nevada COVID rules can favor casinos over churches https://t.co/91QO074q0V

Wearing a mask is not a political statement – which is why I joined my #Michigan colleagues on both sides of the aisle in reminding Michiganders to do your part in preventing the spread of #Covid_19 and wear a mask! https://t.co/C780ybAUu3

My position on additional COVID support - support testing and tracing assist nursing homes and LTC facilities with PPE to protect seniors offer support education K-12 and post-secondary to modify facilities and secure equipment needed.  https://t.co/7jTOJkYHYp

This morning I spoke w/ Chris Renwick on the Frank Beckmann show about reopening schools. We must learn to adapt to COVID-19 and move forward while protecting our teachers & students rather than keeping schools closed & hindering effective education for all of America’s children. https://t.co/ylGIT62mzV

Two experimental COVID-19 vaccines being manufactured in #Michigan received fast-track status through the @US_FDA. This process facilitates the rapid development & expedited review of new drugs and vaccines which are vital to countering this pandemic. https://t.co/3uTvPPkvIv
Another analysis of COVID threat to be considered by all - especially those that repeatedly stress they follow the science. https://t.co/fM9ZMJ24Dy
What?   I am shocked.  You mean the protests celebrated by you and so many other Dem mayors and Governors causes a spike in COVID infections?  Wow  https://t.co/7hHqw1FUd8

@spartanfan0508 @GovWhitmer @RepHuizenga @RepMoolenaar @RepFredUpton @RepJackBergman @RepWalberg If you send a letter to @GovWhitmer about the nursing home deaths on her watch and her executive orders about nursing home facilities and returning patients I will further communicate concerns with the COVID deaths in America. I will await a copy of that letter!

Testing is critical to contain the spread of COVID-19 and get back to a sense of normal. The @MichiganHHS now offers an online test finder tool that allows you to locate the closest testing site based on your specific needs.   Learn more ⬇️ https://t.co/773OAfuzky

I led my Michigan colleagues in a letter to @GovWhitmer demanding she reverse her long-term care facility COVID-19 policy. We know this misguided and dangerous order has led to the unnecessary death of thousands of Michigan's most vulnerable residents.   Read the letter ⬇️ https://t.co/4xZoq4WVlr

First - in Michigan we could grocery shop and simply had to social distance - masks.  Now another @GovWhitmer Executive Order requires face masks in all indoor spaces.  She claims to follow the data - where is the data on this one? https://t.co/Kh1P6SRrVn
@Stealthgirl21 BTW -one of the biggest issues is preventing COVID-19 in nursing homes and long term care facilities.   These are regulated by the state.  Where is @GovWhitmer on that?

@Stealthgirl21 I believe in science and follow the data and studies on COVID-19.  I just disagree with you but you will note I do not suggest you shouldn’t have a voice!   I was elected to have a voice and will continue doing just that.

Yes - the impact upon all citizens must be considered as actions like “stay at home” orders are undertaken.  Michigan’s economy was booming.  Governor Whitmer should have eased quarantines more quickly and reasonably while also protecting people most at risk of COVID-19. https://t.co/mpibNueZ7S

News for #Michigan Farmers: Yesterday the @USDA  announced details of the new Coronavirus Food Assistance Program which will provide relief to America’s farmers and ranchers impacted by the coronavirus pandemic. Producers can apply for assistance beginning on May 26 2020.
I appreciate @realdonaldtrump visiting #Michigan tomorrow to thank Ford GE Healthcare and other Michigan businesses that are producing #PPE and important medical equipment to help fight COVID-19.

Thank you to all nurses on this #NationalNursesDay. Now more than ever we are thankful for those working on the frontlines to keep our loved ones safe. Thank you for selflessly serving your communities in the fight against COVID-19 – we are all eternally grateful. https://t.co/o1VyGPLyv8

I’m appalled that a duly elected Member of Congress would not be recognized to inquire about when and how Members will be able to participate in legislative business in order to help our constituents through the #coronavirus pandemic.

The public health crisis of the coronavirus is tragically real & at the same time there is a widespread economic crisis going on.
